summary:
I am an accomplished Senior Scientist with expertise in BSL-2/BL-2 labs, specializing in biochemistry, biophysics, molecular biology, cell biology, and genetics, including CRISPR applications in mouse, mammalian cells, and bacteria. My comprehensive knowledge extends to managing bioreactors of varying scales, tech transfer, and adherence to GxP regulations.

Throughout my professional journey, I have demonstrated progressive leadership skills supported by strong management, communication, and presentation abilities. As a US Permanent Resident, I bring extensive experience, a passion for innovative research, and a commitment to scientific excellence.

Key highlights of my career include:
• Small molecule/biologic IND preparation and preclinical/clinical data analysis.
• Excelling in DNA-Encoded Small Molecule Library Screening, Binding Affinity and Kinetic Studies, and Next-Generation Sequencing, showcasing proficiency in diverse scientific methodologies.
• Managing a talented team, focusing on USP and Pilot Plant operations, in compliance with GxP regulations; CDMO/CRO Solutions, specializing in AAV, mAb, MSAT and manufacturing;
• Leading the development of mammalian and microbial cells, utilizing CRISPR applications and adhering to GxP regulations.
• Conducting cutting-edge research during my postdoctoral research at Harvard Medical School and Harvard University, exploring the genetics of Cystic Fibrosis Pathogen and CRISPR technologies in human cells and mouse.
• Developing different new Analytical Methods in biochemistry, biophysics, and cell biology throughout my decades of career in life science academia and pharmaceutical industry. mAb/Fc-fusion protein/virus AAV/AdV/LentiV characterization (biochemical and biophysical), antibody-drug conjugate (ADC), in vitro transcription (IVT)
• Authoring, revising, approving pharmaceutical regulations within the company, managing external vendors
• Tech Transfer

Outside of the lab, I enjoy skating, hiking, and traveling throughout New England!

Due to a departmental closure, I am actively seeking opportunities to leverage my skills, leadership, and scientific acumen to contribute significantly to research endeavors and drive innovation in a senior scientist role or higher within a forward-thinking organization.

Email: xiantonioge@gmail.com; antoniogelexington@gmail.com;

SPECIALTIES:

Ph.D./Doctor of Science since 2014 in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology
U.S. Lawful Permanent Resident/Green Card Holder since 2020
Pharmaceutical/BioPharmaceutical Research Professional since 2014
